Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, beautiful rustic style, super clean, but...”
Reviews.Author: Helenga666
Reviews.Content: I was thrilled to find this hotel online as it was exactly where I wanted to stay (Trastevere) and for the right price, and looked 'rustic'.... it definitely ticked all the boxes. The first night we had room 3 which was quite tiny (as I had read it would be) but had no windows (other than a tiny one high up like a basement vent) but we were so tired we just went to bed. Breakfast of your choice (continental) is brought to your room so you really feel pampered in that department. The desk staff were super friendly and gladly gave us a different room upstairs for our next 2 nights. We had room 7 which had a gorgeous little view and was slightly more spacious. The beds are quite hard at this hotel but if you are worn out from sightseeing like we were, it wasn't much of a problem. We didnt need air con or heat as the weather was perfect. Shutters on window let us sleep in a nice dark room in the morning. Very quiet at night so you do get some peace... The bathrooms are quite tiny (a late addition to this several hundred year old building) but everything was so clean and spotless it didnt really matter. They also use these strange 'towels' which were more like bed sheets. But, the location truly does make up for all the little problems, as next to the hotel is one of the best restaurants we enjoyed, Trattoria Ponentina! I wanted to drink and dine there all day! I may stay at this hotel again, what really was a problem was the noise - around 6-7am the staff start bustling around and one staff member would repeatedly WHISTLE loudly while working/cleaning, and as they prepared the continental breakfast trays, we heard alot of dishes banging and clattering loudly.... the walls are paper thin and we could hear the lady next door snoring all night and her hacking cough - yet WE got a complaint for having our tv on quietly at 9pm! So that really put us off, and we desperately needed sleep each morning! But if you are an early riser, this won't be a problem for you! But once again this hotel is excellent overall as you can't have a better location - we looked for other hotels but this one is truly in a great spot, and we also heard it is the former house of singer Lucia Dalla, for those interested in this musician. It is also near Viale Trastevere so super easy for tram and buses into central Rome. Be sure to visit the nice man, Claudio, at Bar Piccolo on the Viale, he has a red nose like WC Fields and we had so much fun hanging out with him one evening!

Reviews.Title: “Single Room”
Reviews.Author: Karin B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location but I wouldn't call the single room value for money. There was no window and the air conditioning played up each night to the point of shuddering and clanging at which point I would turn it off and then it would continue to drip water which would splash on my face. I did report this to reception who did not seem too bothered and nothing was done about it. The room was tiny and the bathroom - what can I say. I don't consider myself tall (5' 6") but my knees were touching the wall in front of me when sat on the toilet. You also had to squeeze past the toilet to access the shower. Breakfast was delivered to the room but there was nowhere to eat it apart from sitting the tray on the bed. All in all the accommodation was disappointing to an otherwise amazing city to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: therewasthisonetime
Reviews.Content: Quite a nice, charming place. Excellent locations and easy on the eye. Downsides were large air-con in the room, loud and not very effective. Book breakfast the night before, and it is bought to your room in the morning. Would I go back? Maybe, but not in the middle of summer.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: lenlab631
Reviews.Content: My original plans to stay at a "B&B" in Trastevere fell through and I was left walking around with my backpack looking for alternative accommodations. For some reason availability was low and after a few hours of looking for a place, I settled for Hotel Borgo Antico. What a nightmare! First, the room was dark and musty. There was a window but very little light passed through. The phone in my room didn't work. I spoke with the person at the reception every day to let them know that the phone wasn't working and nothing was done about it. They provide breakfast in your room. There is a paper at the front desk in the afternoon/evening so you can write down breakfast preferences. If you don't indicate or call them ahead of time, they give you a hard time about it. The last morning of my stay as I broke off a piece of my bread, an army of ants crawled all over my breakfast tray. When I returned the tray, they promised to give me another breakfast. After waiting 30 minutes, I had lost my appetite and told that I no longer wanted the breakfast. In the 3 nights that I spent there, I didn't not have one peaceful night of sleep. Between the noise of the pipes, toilet flushing and loud neighbors, I was up everyday at 4am. I mentioned this to the person at the reception and he was somewhat helpful. They had wifi but it was intermittent. I would never stay and this place ever again!

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked?”
Reviews.Author: Guest_163
Reviews.Content: Although we booked this hotel while the site said there were four rooms available, they could not lodge us. Instead we were moved to a nearby hotel, called Hotel Domus Tiberina. The room in this hotel was ok for us, but I felt a littlebit cheated to. I do not like the feeling. This way, any hotel bookable through bookings.com could expand the number of the rooms unlimitedly, and guests would end up in non-booked hotels. Often, their location is relevant to guests. Their site should have said Antico Borgo Di Trastevere was full, and might recommend e.g. Hotel Domus Tiberina. That way I could have made my own choice. As it is with the former, the latter hotel is very noisy too. By the way, the showering cabin sliding doors allow for max 30 cm opening. Larger people cannot take a shower in room 21.

Reviews.Title: “over priced”
Reviews.Author: sheatripoli
Reviews.Content: This small and ancient hotel is in a corner of Trastevere- which was a great location, BUT the room was minisucule, as was the shower. There were NO amenities ie towels were large clothes, no soap, no area within the hotel or in the room to sit. Trastevere is very noisy at night, so it is close to the center of a very lively night life but the hotel sits right on the street so forget about sleeping.Since it is an old hotel the walls are paper thin and one could hear what was going on in the rooms next door. The biggest complaint we had was how overpriced it was....also the included breakfast was terrible. Don't believe what you read in Lonely Planet about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Cute little hotel in Rome's best neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Putnik13
Reviews.Content: Cute little hotel in Rome's best neighborhood. Perfect location in charming old building on a sidestreet without traffic. Altough, it is not for spoiled travellers who expect North American room standards, nor for kids. Rooms are really small, as are bathrooms, but hotel is charming.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever”
Reviews.Author: teredub
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very nice area but apart from that it has been a very disappointing experience. We went there with our 3 children. The bathroom (bathroom? just a toilet, a sink and a shower with no place even to have your beautycase at easy reach) is so small that you cannot move around (imagine with small children...) and the smell was disgusting. There is no phone, no fridge, they do not even sell you a bottle of water for the night . Breakfast is served in your room but there is no space for the tray and you end up having your breakfast on the bed. We asked for 2 nights in a row to have orange juice for breakfast and instead we had pineapple juice (which of course the kids did not like). When we asked why they said they did not have any. Service is awful, the staff is not friendly, definitely customer service is not their best. The price is too high for what you get. I would definitely not recommend it to a family with young children. When I complained I got 20 euro back per night, but I still think that we paid too much for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Great neighborhood, disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: edan4664
Reviews.Content: This is a charming little hotel in a great neighborhood, but it definitely has some downsides. First, it is not the easiest place to find as it is located in a small alley that is not marked on many maps of Rome. The directions provided on the hotel website were not particularly helpful. We ended up walking around (with all of our luggage) for quite some time before we found it. The rooms are incredibly tiny for the price. We were initially put in the room right near the reception desk. The A/C did not work in this room. We complained about this for 2 days before they finally moved us to a room that had working A/C. Unfortunatley, the staff was neither helpful nor friendly about resolving this situation. In fact, we really didn't find that any of the staff members were friendly at all. They tell you that breakfast is included, but you either have to go to a nearby hotel, or have it served in your room. You also have to ask about breakfast, as they did not volunteer this information to us. Our first morning, I asked where the breakfast room was. The woman at the front desk told me that they could bring coffee or juice to our room, but that was all. It wasn't until the second day that we found out about the nearby hotel option from a different front desk person. All in all, not a bad place to stay. It's a bit overpriced for what you get. But the neighborhood makes up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Wet towels”
Reviews.Author: LuluSweet
Reviews.Content: First the positive things: This hotel is in a great area, and the rooms, while tiny, are charming. The staff were reasonably friendly although they couldn't answer some pretty basic questions. But there's this place is NOT worth 120 Euros a night - it was more like something that would normally be about 90 Euros, if that. The towels and pillows were really thin, the breakfast included things that had been opened by someone else, the heater could be operated only by a remote control (that had no batteries), and the taxi driver the hotel arranged to pick us up at the airport charged almost double what the price should have been (yes, we should have found out what the normal price was ahead of time!). To top it off, the hotel apparently has a policy of not changing towels daily, which would have been fine if they had told us ahead of time. Instead, after a long day of walking around Rome, mostly in the rain, we arrived back at the hotel to find our two wet bath towels, one wet hand towel, and one wet bath mat all neatly folded and stacked in a pile, but still wet. I would definitely not return!

Reviews.Title: “A Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: cheeseandchalk
Reviews.Content: Booking a room in this hotel was a very bad choice. The staff and manager were rude and unhelpful. The manager does not know what customer care means and only shouts at customers. That was a really scary experience. A hotel to be avoided at all cost.

Reviews.Title: “Trip Medieval Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm confused, we wait low season to found accomodation in this Hotel, I stay with my wife 3 days in this Hotel the staff was really helpfull, the room was small, but when we book the manager inform me about the rooms size, was absolutly positive our stay in this Hotel. Why some travellers write bad opinion? I dont think the staff are unhelpfull and I think the name of the Hotel inform the travellers THIS IS HOUSE 17th century. Anyway all rooms are small but extremly clean equipped with all comforts I'll be back on May.

Reviews.Title: “Awful - Do not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just came back from 2 weeks in Italy and staying at this place was the only negative. It was unbelievably small - we were stuck up in an attic room that essentially only had space for the bed. We had nowhere to sit or stand and could not open our suitcases at the same time. The room would have been too small even for just one person. There was a horrible smell in the hotel from the restaurant next door and it was unbelievably noisy. Every morning at 7am, the cleaning woman pounded down the stairs (we thought to make breakfast, but no, since breakfast is served at one of their hotels blocks away). The walls were paper thin and we were also woken up by the receptionists loud talking on the first floor (despite being in the attic). We complained and got absolutely nowhere. This was the most expensive place we stayed at and by far the absolute worst. They should be ashamed for charging so much for this place (140 euros) - even at 90 euros it would be too much. Do not stay here - you will be unhappy. It was a horrible way to start and end the day everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location ... BUT ...”
Reviews.Author: PercyP_g
Reviews.Content: The Trastevere House is in a wonderful location. Lots of excellent restaurants nearby (we never had a disappointing meal), a real neighbourhood feel, interesting little streets to explore, and surprisingly handy for getting to all of the usual tourist sights (either walking or taking the frequent tram). Plus it's lovely to stroll along the river at sunset (and stop by the excellent geletaria on Little Trastevere Island). But, oh yes indeed, the hotel itself leaves much to be desired. Our room was very noisy, it flooded, and the manager was never there when he was needed. The staff did their best--and the room was very clean. It's a shame since this hotel has potential. It's in a charming old building (and you have to expect that an old building will have its problems) and I really liked having breakfast in bed (I'd have liked it even better if the capuccino hadn't been lukewarm!). But instead of plasma screen TVs that show only Italian programming, the owner should invest in soundproofing between the rooms and the pizzeria next door and in windows that cut down the noise. And, whatever you do, be sure to avoid room one!

Reviews.Title: “Would be more aptly named "Travesty House"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There are *some* good things about what Trastavere House. The location is excellent - steps from a tram that will take you across the Tiber, and walking distance (though a good walk) to the Forum, etc. It was clean, and there was air conditioning. However, this hotel is ridiculously priced for what it offers. We were first placed into a tiny room that was next to the front desk and had holes in the wall. We could hear every telephone call that the clerk made, and every entrance and exit of hotel guests. Moreover, the hotel is next to a very loud pizza restaurant which operates well into the night. The room where the restaurant washes its dishes abuts the hotel, and makes it impossible to sleep. The bathroom in our initial room wasn't really a bathroom. There was a shower that opened directly into the room, and in a separate part of the room there was a toilet in a closet. When we asked to change rooms, they did accomodate us the next day and switched us to a (marginally better) different room. In the second room there was an actual bathroom with a shower and toilet in the same area with a place to dry off after a shower. However, the door would not open from the inside, and I would not recommend taking a shower without someone present to let you out! Breakfast was adequate, and I personally enjoyed having it in the room. On our second day there, the bathroom flooded. We immediately let the front desk clerk know. He nodded, unfazed - this is clearly not a one-off happening. "Just keep your belongings off the floor" he advised. We were privy to the conversations of those people next door to us - in our original tiny, holed-wall room. Each day they would put a new couple in, and complaints would ensue and the people would either leave (if they were smart and could find another hotel), or be moved to another room. Strangely, each room had a plasma flat-screen TV, but no channels in anything but Italian (not that I particularly want to watch television while in Rome, but really, why spend a ridiculous amount of money on televisions that don't show anything?). There were no telephones, which was strange. All in all, I can't recommend the Travesty House, although I loved staying in Trastavere. They do have a sister hotel which I think is better - it is called Domus Tiberus.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little alley”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I visited rome for 5 days and stayed at this lovely Hotel. We had a room on the first floor with the window on the alley side and we liked it a lot. I must say that the room was small but we had everything we needed and the air-conditioning was brand new. We found the front desk very helpfull and they gave us a lot of information. The breakfast was served in the room which was okay for us but I can imagine that some people don't like that and want a breakfast room. The area is full of restaurants and bars, so in the evening you find everything nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon location was excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stay 3 days in Rome was funny to find staff helpfull, our first experience in Rome was excellent. The hotel was very clean and very quiet we stay in the first floor with nice view ancient house, the owner explain about the history of trastevere special the church next to the Hotel and all most important tourist attraction. About the location was great 50 mt from the main street Trastevere crossing the Tiber Island we reach Campo de Fiori, Navona square, the Pantheon, the Roman Forum and the Colisseum and even the Vatican City is within a walking distance colosseum Vatican city all in one day. All day the staff bring excellent capuccino with deliciuos "cornetti".

Reviews.Title: “Truly wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: gretchenenders
Reviews.Content: The room was definitely on the small side but the welcoming and attentive staff made this a truly wonderful stay. Breafast in bed included cappucino that helped us welcome each new day in Rome. Clean and affordable and close to all the great sights. For those on a budget who refuse to skimp on service, Trastevere House is the perfect place.

Reviews.Title: “A tad noisy but Charming and Clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a one week vacation in Rome, booked through go-today, with the entire stay at the Trastevere House. The trip was extremely affordable--cheap even. Although the hotel is a little noisy, due to the late night walking around neighbors in the residental Trastevere area and visitors to the front desk staff, we found the hotel to be charming and clean with a nice window box of flowers. The staff was available 24 hours a day and were very friendly and helpful. If you enjoy becoming part of the local area, including eating dinner late in the evening and returning home at the same time as most of the neighbors, being able to walk to tons of local, excellent restaurants (including those in the former "Jewish Ghetto") a small but clean room, and a lovely setting you will likely enjoy Trastevere House.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny, noisy”
Reviews.Author: misskimma
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week-long trip to Rome, and stayed at Trastevere House booked through a package with gotoday.com. Luckily it was (a) winter and (b) not tourist season. The rooms were tiny, and we were unfortunate enough to get a room at the front of the building, right on the street. If the windows were open you could hear people on the street as if they were in your room. Luckily there wasn't foot traffic going by after 11pm or so. Also luckily we got up fairly early every day...we would have been forced to with the scooters zooming by and waking us up. I had more complaint with the internal noise...the walls were made of tissue paper! Thankfully it was 2 single travellers in the room next to us, and not 2 honeymooners! We could hear every word that was whispered in the room next door, and every click of the lightswitch. Beware of this hotel in the summer months! There is no air-conditioning, and no air circulation in the small rooms. It would be suffocating, I can only imagine. The room itself was tiny (as I mentioned), but I expected that. However, it was clean and the bathroom was also clean and fully functional. Breakfast itself was fine, if you could get it. The meal consisted of cappucino, orange juice (more like Tang), a croissant and a roll. We had trouble getting breakfast on time a few days. One day we left early for a tour of Pompeii and were told that we left too early to receive breakfast. I'm sure all hotels have breakfast hours, so I can't really complain about that. There were no phones or alarm clocks in the room, but I didn't expect them. I did find the front desk to be unmanned a few times, but not enough for it to be a problem. I found the front desk people to be helpful and accomodating. This hotel is in a great location for restaurants, every night we found a great new place to eat that was really close. It was also close enough for us to walk to City Center in just a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy sleep”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night and found it noisy and cramped. The walls were thin and the door to the room didn't block out any sound. Breakfast was a joke -- the worst I had in the 3 weeks I was in Italy. There are better places to be found in the same price range.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Antico Borgo di Trastevere
HotelInfo.Address: Vicolo del Buco 7, 00153 Rome, Italy
